title: LangGraph for Beginners – Build Agentic Workflows Step-by-Step

overview.description: A hands-on, beginner-friendly introduction to LangGraph – the powerful framework for creating stateful, multi-actor AI agents with cycles and branching logic. Learn how to build simple to advanced agent workflows (single agent, multi-agent, hierarchical) using visual nodes, state management, persistence, and human-in-the-loop patterns. Every lesson includes clear explanations, micro-exercises, ready-to-run Jupyter notebooks, and small projects.
overview.target_audience: Beginners who know basic Python and want to build reliable, controllable AI agents that can plan, remember state, and loop until a task is complete.

modules.title: Introduction to LangGraph
modules.description: Learn the fundamentals of LangGraph and its architecture.

lessons.title: What is LangGraph?
lessons.summary: An overview of LangGraph and its capabilities.

hands_on_labs.title: Setting Up LangGraph
hands_on_labs.goal: Install LangGraph and run a sample workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Identify LangGraph Components
micro_exercises.task: List and describe the main components of LangGraph.

micro_exercises.title: Explore Use Cases
micro_exercises.task: Research and present two use cases for LangGraph.

knowledge_check.question: What is LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: LangGraph is a framework for creating stateful AI agents.

knowledge_check.question: What are the key features of LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: Key features include state management, multi-agent support, and visual workflows.

real_world_use_cases: Creating AI agents for task automation

lessons.title: LangGraph Architecture
lessons.summary: Dive into the architecture of LangGraph and its components.

hands_on_labs.title: Creating Your First Node
hands_on_labs.goal: Build a simple node in LangGraph.

micro_exercises.title: Node Identification
micro_exercises.task: Identify and describe different types of nodes in LangGraph.

micro_exercises.title: Edge Creation
micro_exercises.task: Create edges between nodes in a sample workflow.

knowledge_check.question: What is a node in LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: A node represents a specific task or action in the workflow.

knowledge_check.question: How do edges function in LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: Edges connect nodes and define the flow of execution.

common_mistakes: Misunderstanding the role of nodes and edges

lessons.title: Setting Up Your LangGraph Environment
lessons.summary: Learn how to set up the LangGraph environment for development.

hands_on_labs.title: LangGraph Installation Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully install LangGraph and run a sample application.

micro_exercises.title: Package Installation
micro_exercises.task: Install LangGraph and any dependencies.

micro_exercises.title: Run Sample Application
micro_exercises.task: Run a provided sample LangGraph application.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to install LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: You can use pip install langgraph.

knowledge_check.question: How can you verify the installation?
knowledge_check.answer: Run a sample application to ensure it executes without errors.

real_world_use_cases: Setting up a development environment for AI projects

modules.title: Building Basic Workflows
modules.description: Learn how to create simple workflows using LangGraph.

lessons.title: Creating Your First Workflow
lessons.summary: Step-by-step guide to building a basic workflow in LangGraph.

hands_on_labs.title: Build a Simple Task Workflow
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a workflow that automates a simple task.

micro_exercises.title: Node Addition
micro_exercises.task: Add at least three nodes to your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Edge Connection
micro_exercises.task: Connect the nodes with edges to define the workflow.

knowledge_check.question: What is a workflow in LangGraph?
knowledge_check.answer: A workflow is a sequence of tasks represented by nodes and edges.

knowledge_check.question: How do you add a node to a workflow?
knowledge_check.answer: You can add a node by defining its properties and connecting it to other nodes.

lessons.title: Implementing Conditional Logic
lessons.summary: Learn how to add conditional logic to your workflows.

hands_on_labs.title: Conditional Workflow Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a workflow that uses conditional logic.

micro_exercises.title: Define Conditions
micro_exercises.task: Write if statements for your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Test Your Workflow
micro_exercises.task: Run your workflow and check the output based on conditions.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of an if statement?
knowledge_check.answer: An if statement allows you to execute code based on a condition.

knowledge_check.question: How do you implement branching logic?
knowledge_check.answer: By using if, elif, and else statements to control the flow.

lessons.title: Testing and Debugging Workflows
lessons.summary: Learn how to test and debug your workflows effectively.

hands_on_labs.title: Debugging Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Identify and fix errors in a provided workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Run Tests
micro_exercises.task: Run tests on your workflow and document the results.

micro_exercises.title: Error Analysis
micro_exercises.task: Analyze error messages and suggest fixes.

knowledge_check.question: What is the importance of testing workflows?
knowledge_check.answer: Testing ensures that workflows function as intended and helps identify issues.

knowledge_check.question: What should you do when you encounter an error?
knowledge_check.answer: Analyze the error message and debug the workflow accordingly.

modules.title: Advanced Workflow Techniques
modules.description: Explore advanced techniques for building complex workflows.

lessons.title: State Management in LangGraph
lessons.summary: Learn how to manage state within your workflows.

hands_on_labs.title: State Management Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement state management in a sample workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Define State Variables
micro_exercises.task: Create state variables for your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Test State Changes
micro_exercises.task: Run your workflow and observe state changes.

knowledge_check.question: What is state in a workflow?
knowledge_check.answer: State refers to the current condition or data held by the workflow.

knowledge_check.question: Why is state management important?
knowledge_check.answer: It allows workflows to remember information and make decisions based on past inputs.

real_world_use_cases: Creating workflows that remember user input

lessons.title: Using Loops in Workflows
lessons.summary: Implement loops to repeat tasks within workflows.

hands_on_labs.title: Loop Implementation Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a workflow that uses loops to automate tasks.

micro_exercises.title: Implement a For Loop
micro_exercises.task: Add a for loop to iterate over a list in your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Implement a While Loop
micro_exercises.task: Add a while loop to repeat a task until a condition is met.

knowledge_check.question: What is a for loop?
knowledge_check.answer: A for loop iterates over a sequence, executing code for each item.

knowledge_check.question: What is a while loop?
knowledge_check.answer: A while loop repeats code as long as a condition is true.

lessons.title: Optimizing Workflows
lessons.summary: Learn techniques to optimize your workflows for performance.

hands_on_labs.title: Workflow Optimization Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Analyze and optimize a provided workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Analyze Performance
micro_exercises.task: Run performance tests on your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Optimizations
micro_exercises.task: Apply optimizations to improve workflow efficiency.

knowledge_check.question: What are performance bottlenecks?
knowledge_check.answer: Bottlenecks are points in the workflow that slow down execution.

knowledge_check.question: How can you optimize a workflow?
knowledge_check.answer: By analyzing performance and applying techniques to improve efficiency.

modules.title: Multi-Agent Workflows
modules.description: Explore the creation of workflows involving multiple agents.

lessons.title: Introduction to Multi-Agent Workflows
lessons.summary: Understand the basics of multi-agent systems and their applications.

hands_on_labs.title: Multi-Agent System Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a simple multi-agent system.

micro_exercises.title: Define Multi-Agent Use Cases
micro_exercises.task: List and describe two use cases for multi-agent systems.

micro_exercises.title: Identify Agent Interactions
micro_exercises.task: Describe how agents can interact in a multi-agent system.

knowledge_check.question: What is a multi-agent system?
knowledge_check.answer: A system composed of multiple interacting agents.

knowledge_check.question: What are some applications of multi-agent systems?
knowledge_check.answer: Applications include collaborative problem-solving and distributed control.

lessons.title: Creating Multi-Agent Workflows
lessons.summary: Learn how to create workflows that involve multiple agents.

hands_on_labs.title: Multi-Agent Workflow Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a workflow that involves multiple agents working together.

micro_exercises.title: Define Agent Roles
micro_exercises.task: Outline the roles of each agent in your workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Test Agent Communication
micro_exercises.task: Run your workflow and observe agent interactions.

knowledge_check.question: How do you define roles for agents?
knowledge_check.answer: Roles can be defined based on the tasks each agent is responsible for.

knowledge_check.question: What is the importance of agent communication?
knowledge_check.answer: Effective communication allows agents to collaborate and complete tasks efficiently.

common_mistakes: Failing to define clear roles for agents

lessons.title: Testing Multi-Agent Interactions
lessons.summary: Learn how to test and debug interactions between multiple agents.

hands_on_labs.title: Multi-Agent Testing Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Test and debug a multi-agent workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Run Interaction Tests
micro_exercises.task: Run tests on your multi-agent workflow and document results.

micro_exercises.title: Analyze Communication Issues
micro_exercises.task: Identify and suggest fixes for any communication problems.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of testing multi-agent interactions?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure that agents can communicate and collaborate effectively.

knowledge_check.question: What should you do if you encounter communication issues?
knowledge_check.answer: Analyze the workflow and debug the interactions between agents.

real_world_use_cases: Ensuring smooth operation of multi-agent systems

modules.title: Persistence and Memory in Workflows
modules.description: Learn how to implement persistence and memory in your workflows.

lessons.title: Understanding Memory in Workflows
lessons.summary: Explore the concept of memory in workflows and its importance.

hands_on_labs.title: Memory Implementation Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement memory in a sample workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Define Memory Types
micro_exercises.task: List and describe different types of memory used in workflows.

micro_exercises.title: Explain Memory Importance
micro_exercises.task: Write a brief explanation of why memory is important in workflows.

knowledge_check.question: What is memory in a workflow?
knowledge_check.answer: Memory refers to the ability of a workflow to retain information across executions.

knowledge_check.question: Why is memory important?
knowledge_check.answer: It allows workflows to adapt based on previous interactions and data.

real_world_use_cases: Creating workflows that remember user preferences

lessons.title: Implementing Persistent Data Storage
lessons.summary: Learn how to store data persistently in workflows.

hands_on_labs.title: Data Storage Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Implement a data storage solution in a sample workflow.

micro_exercises.title: Define Storage Types
micro_exercises.task: List and describe different types of data storage solutions.

micro_exercises.title: Test Data Retrieval
micro_exercises.task: Implement and test data retrieval methods.

knowledge_check.question: What is persistent data storage?
knowledge_check.answer: Persistent data storage allows data to be saved and retrieved across sessions.

knowledge_check.question: Why is data retrieval important?
knowledge_check.answer: It enables workflows to access previously stored information.

real_world_use_cases: Storing user data for future interactions

lessons.title: Utilizing Stateful Workflows
lessons.summary: Learn how to create workflows that maintain state across executions.

hands_on_labs.title: Stateful Workflow Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a stateful workflow that remembers user interactions.

micro_exercises.title: Define Stateful Characteristics
micro_exercises.task: List characteristics of stateful workflows.

micro_exercises.title: Test Stateful Behavior
micro_exercises.task: Run your stateful workflow and observe its behavior.

knowledge_check.question: What is a stateful workflow?
knowledge_check.answer: A stateful workflow retains information across executions.

knowledge_check.question: Why is state management important in workflows?
knowledge_check.answer: It allows workflows to adapt and respond to user inputs effectively.

real_world_use_cases: Creating workflows that adapt to user behavior

modules.title: Deploying LangGraph Agents
modules.description: Learn how to deploy your LangGraph agents as web APIs.

lessons.title: Introduction to Deployment
lessons.summary: Understand the basics of deploying LangGraph agents.

hands_on_labs.title: Deployment Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Deploy a simple LangGraph agent as a web API.

micro_exercises.title: Define Deployment Types
micro_exercises.task: List and describe different types of deployment options.

micro_exercises.title: Explain Deployment Process
micro_exercises.task: Outline the steps involved in deploying an agent.

knowledge_check.question: What is deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: Deployment is the process of making an application accessible for use.

knowledge_check.question: What are common deployment options?
knowledge_check.answer: Common options include cloud services, on-premises servers, and containerization.

real_world_use_cases: Making agents accessible via the web

lessons.title: Creating Web APIs for LangGraph Agents
lessons.summary: Learn how to create web APIs for your LangGraph agents.

hands_on_labs.title: API Implementation Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Create and test a web API for a LangGraph agent.

micro_exercises.title: Define API Principles
micro_exercises.task: List and describe key principles of API design.

micro_exercises.title: Test Your API
micro_exercises.task: Run tests on your API to ensure it functions correctly.

knowledge_check.question: What is a web API?
knowledge_check.answer: A web API allows applications to communicate over the internet.

knowledge_check.question: Why is testing important for APIs?
knowledge_check.answer: Testing ensures that the API behaves as expected and handles errors gracefully.

real_world_use_cases: Interfacing with agents via HTTP requests

lessons.title: Testing and Debugging Deployed Agents
lessons.summary: Learn how to test and debug your deployed LangGraph agents.

hands_on_labs.title: Deployed Agent Testing Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Test and debug a deployed LangGraph agent.

micro_exercises.title: Run Deployment Tests
micro_exercises.task: Run tests on your deployed agent and document results.

micro_exercises.title: Analyze Issues
micro_exercises.task: Identify and suggest fixes for any issues encountered.

knowledge_check.question: Why is testing important after deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: To ensure that the agent functions correctly in a live environment.

knowledge_check.question: What should you do if you encounter issues?
knowledge_check.answer: Analyze the logs and debug the agent to resolve issues.

modules.title: Capstone Project
modules.description: Integrate all skills learned to build a complete LangGraph agent.
module_outcomes: Deploy the agent as a web API

lessons.title: Capstone Project Overview

micro_exercises.title: Identify Resources
micro_exercises.task: Identify the resources you will need for your project.

knowledge_check.question: What are the key components of a project plan?
knowledge_check.answer: Objectives, resources, timeline, and deliverables.

knowledge_check.question: Why is planning important?
knowledge_check.answer: Planning helps ensure that the project stays on track and meets its goals.

lessons.title: Building Your LangGraph Agent
lessons.summary: Step-by-step guide to building your LangGraph agent.

hands_on_labs.title: Agent Building Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Build and test your LangGraph agent.

micro_exercises.title: Implement Workflows
micro_exercises.task: Create and implement workflows for your agent.

micro_exercises.title: Test Agent Functionality
micro_exercises.task: Run tests to ensure your agent works as intended.

knowledge_check.question: What is the first step in building your agent?
knowledge_check.answer: Define the workflows that the agent will execute.

knowledge_check.question: How do you test your agent's functionality?
knowledge_check.answer: By running scenarios and checking the outputs.

lessons.title: Deploying Your LangGraph Agent
lessons.summary: Learn how to deploy your completed LangGraph agent.

hands_on_labs.title: Deployment Lab
hands_on_labs.goal: Deploy your LangGraph agent as a web API.

micro_exercises.title: Deploy Your Agent
micro_exercises.task: Follow the steps to deploy your LangGraph agent.

micro_exercises.title: Test Your Deployment
micro_exercises.task: Run tests on your deployed agent to ensure functionality.

knowledge_check.question: What is the final step in the project?
knowledge_check.answer: Deploying the agent and ensuring it works as expected.

knowledge_check.question: Why is testing important after deployment?
knowledge_check.answer: To confirm that the agent operates correctly in a live environment.

real_world_use_cases: Making your agent accessible to users

capstone.title: Capstone Project Title
capstone.description: Integrate all skills learned to build a complete LangGraph agent.
deliverables: Deploy the agent as a web API
